articles.title: US Water Law
articles.description: An overview of legislation related to water resources in the United States.
articles.contents:
Regulators
Laws and regulations
Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA)
Clean Water Act (CWA)
Beaches Environmental Assessment and Coastal Health (BEACH) Act
National Pollutant Discharge Elmination System (NPDES)
Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA)
Compliance and enforcement
Ground Water Rule
Regulations
Regulations 1.

Regulations explain the technical, operational, and legal details necessary to implement laws. Regulations are mandatory requirements that can apply to individuals, businesses, state or local governments, non-profit institutions, or others↩︎

articles.title: US Water Quality Guidelines
articles.description: An overview of water quality guidelines in the US.
articles.contents:
National Primary Drinking Water Regulations (NPDWRs)
The goal of primary standards is to protect public health by limiting the levels of contaminants in drinking water. The NPDWRs set maximum contaminant levels (MCLs)1 which are legally enforceable along with maximum contaminant level goals (MCLGs) which are public health targets that are not legally enforceable. The NPDWRs apply to public water systems (PWS)2.
National Secondary Drinking Water Regulations (NSDWRs)

The highest level of a contaminant that is allowed in drinking water↩︎
A water supply system that provides water for human consumption through pipes or other constructed conveyances to at least 15 service connections or serves an average of at least 25 people for at least 60 days a year. A public water system may be publicly or privately owned.↩︎
